intro: Lacosteopsis auriculata, commonly known as the auriculate lacosteopsis, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its unique leaf shape, with ear-like lobes, gives it its common name. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
